abstract: Peter Thiel’s Valar Ventures Management has made its first foray in Brazil, leading an investment in an e-commerce start-up that is trying to shake up the traditional furniture market here and take on an established retailer recently acquired by the Carlyle Group.
snippet: Peter Thiel’s Valar Ventures Management has made its first foray in Brazil, leading an investment in an e-commerce start-up that is trying to shake up the traditional furniture market here and take on an established retailer recently acquired by t...
lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — Peter Thiel’s Valar Ventures Management has made its first foray in Brazil, leading an investment in an e-commerce start-up that is trying to shake up the traditional furniture market here and take on an established retailer recently acquired by the Carlyle Group.

headline.main: Thiel Fund Leads Investment in Brazilian Start-Up

abstract: One of the legal weapons most feared on Wall Street — the Martin Act — is powering the New York attorney general’s new lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase over mortgage-backed securities.
snippet: One of the legal weapons most feared on Wall Street — the Martin Act — is powering the New York attorney general’s new lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase over mortgage-backed securities.
lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general’s new lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase over mortgage-backed securities showcases one of the legal weapons most feared on Wall Street: the Martin Act.

headline.main: In JPMorgan Case, the Martin Act Rides Again

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The lawsuit filed by Attorney General Eric Schneiderman of New York against JPMorgan Chase over flawed mortgage-backed securities contains little new information about Wall Street’s practices.
snippet: The lawsuit filed by Attorney General Eric Schneiderman of New York against JPMorgan Chase over flawed mortgage-backed securities contains little new information about Wall Street’s practices.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit filed by New York Attorney General Eric T. Schneiderman against JPMorgan Chase for flawed mortgage-backed securities issued by Bear Stearns arrives a bit late in the game.

headline.main: In JPMorgan Suit, a Lack of New News
